meanings.definition: One that surpasses or exceeds in some respect.
meanings.sent1: In the race, the fastest runner was the surpasser of all.
meanings.sent2: The student who scored the highest marks was the surpasser in the class.
meanings.sent3: The little squirrel became the surpasser of all the other animals in the forest when it found the biggest acorn.
meanings.sent4: The sun, shining brighter than all the stars, was the surpasser in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The superhero, with powers beyond imagination, was the ultimate surpasser of evil.

meanings.definition: To go beyond in excellence or achievement.
meanings.sent1: She aimed to surpass her previous record in the upcoming competition.
meanings.sent2: With hard work and dedication, he managed to surpass all expectations.
meanings.sent3: The cake was so delicious that it surpassed all other desserts at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness and generosity surpassed any material gifts she could give.
meanings.sent5: The artist's masterpiece surpassed all other works in the gallery, leaving everyone in awe.
